title: League client update Q&A: The Play Loop [Now Complete]
body:
- - - - - 

_And that's a wrap for this Q&A! Thanks to all of you who stopped by to ask your questions -- we'll be back for more live Q&As in the future! Until then, make sure to keep watching the [League client update website](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update/news) for more news and announcements._

- - - - - 

https://am-a.akamaihd.net/image?f=http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/upload/lcu_webarticle_alpha_r1-loc.jpg

Hey, summoners!

Some members of the League client update alpha team took a brief field trip to the Dev Corner board. Check out the players' questions about our current focus area (the Summoner's Rift + ARAM play loops) that were answered below. 

On hand for the Q&A, we had: 

* Andrew "**sparkly unicorns**" McVeigh - Tech Dev
* Brandon "**CapnBranFlakes**" Felczer - Community
* Dan "**Riot Jules Fern**" Glegg - Tech Dev
* Doruk "**cCc Grumbles cCc**" Kadioglu - Publishing
* Joe "**Riot Hark**" Korsmo - Publishing
* Kevin "**Sixblades**" Kvalstad - Visual Design
* Nikki "**Riot Sweet**" Galvan - Friend's List Design
* Nabil "**AccuracyByVolume**" Kassem - UX Design
* Ryan "**Cactopus**" Rigney - Publishing


Join the alpha construction crew and learn more about the League client update alpha here:

* [Join the League client update alpha](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update)
* [Bugs, Reliability, and a Fresh New Ride](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update/article/d1cc6571-3981-479b-abcf-9b073cfd918a)
* [Crafting the Client: The Play Loop](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update/article/7ea1c643-5c43-4e68-9791-c8772c4bc9c0)
* [Hextech Brings the Magic: Defining a Visual Style](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update/article/2e479430-d2b9-47cf-80e8-c3b3f54c750a)
* [The League client update alpha starts now](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update/article/99400be7-af9e-40cc-a7d4-64b37db2869b)
* [Prepare to Test: SR and ARAM](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update/article/0fbaca41-5f9f-4325-9ce8-830928e78c78)

18. Ping shown in client.

21. Stop failed que pops from deleting chat messages in progress.

SO WHERE IS MY ALPHA INVITE!?

With that out of the way, here are my actual questions. Answer any you want to, I'm not picky:

* Why the long time for the client? We've heard rumblings since 2012 that Riot was working on a new client, was it just a scope issue?
* Is the final client going to be an updated version of the one we have now or will there be new features coming with it entirely?
* Is there a reason you chose ARAM and SR for the play loop?
* Why the hextech design and not, say, a more runic design ala the older client?

> [{quoted}](name=CaptainMårvelous,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=k6KVKAG3,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2016-05-20T18:28:36.639+0000)
>
> SO WHERE IS MY ALPHA INVITE!?
> 
> With that out of the way, here are my actual questions. Answer any you want to, I'm not picky:
> 
> * Why the long time for the client? We've heard rumblings since 2012 that Riot was working on a new client, was it just a scope issue?
> * Is the final client going to be an updated version of the one we have now or will there be new features coming with it entirely?
> * Is there a reason you chose ARAM and SR for the play loop?
> * Why the hextech design and not, say, a more runic design ala the older client?

Ahoy there, captain!

* Improvements to the legacy client have never stopped, but we chose to re-scope this _major_ update a couple times as the needs of League and players have changed over the years. 
* Our focus is on upgrading the client's underlying tech, improving the visual & audio design, and player quality-of-life improvements across all the existing features. We're not planning any brand new features at _launch_, but new League features are always in development and will get added to the updated client when they launch.
* All queues will get added over the course of the alpha, but we started with ARAM and SR blind pick since these are the "safest" tech-wise to start with as we put the updated client tech through its paces.
* We designed the client's visual & audio with 2 key goals in mind: (1) a consistent visual & audio style (hextech UI) to the client that _feels_ true to League as it is today, and (2) a clean, intuitive interface that any Riot dev team can extend and adapt to fit with new League features in the future. If you're interested in learning more, [check out the client Visual Style blog from our design team!](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update/article/2e479430-d2b9-47cf-80e8-c3b3f54c750a)

We're revamping the Runes and Masteries pages to fit the look of the updated client, which includes rearranging the positioning of the rune slots in particular to be more intuitive.

We'll have more detailed info about the Profile & Collection sections in a later alpha release, but the basic idea is that the **Profile** section is all about your identity as a player, including your match history and stats, and the **Collection** section contains all the champs, skins, runes, masteries, and other stuff you've unlocked.
With the new client will there be new features in it(replay system? :D) or just aesthetic changes and a better working client?

Our goal right now is to just get it up to par with the legacy client while 

1) Making it look hawt
2) Using a different, better, newer platform (which will ULTIMATELY be less buggy, thanks largely to our testers)
3) Adopting some internal tool changes that allow us to make new features more quickly/efficiently. 

So while the alpha client *probably* won't have any significant new features when we go to beta, its design will allow us to prioritize new stuff later on.

What technologies will be powering the new client? Language, framework? If you rolled your own, care to tell something about its technical side?

> [{quoted}](name=MDFang,realm=EUW,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=k6KVKAG3,comment-id=001d,timestamp=2016-05-20T20:26:11.144+0000)
>
> What technologies will be powering the new client? Language, framework? If you rolled your own, care to tell something about its technical side?

TL;DR screens are built in HTML5/Javascript. Communications code is in C++

Slightly more tech focused answer: We’ve built a system around Chromium Embedded Framework, in part because of the rich media possibilities. We’ve also taken great care to make it extensible, so that features can be added by teams without impacting others. So, client screens are built in HTML5/JS and communications-level features are built in C++. We’ll be publishing an in depth blog on the architecture in the near future here: 
https://engineering.riotgames.com/

Plus, I got two question about the new client but they aren't for Summoner's Rift and ARAM changes.
-Why choice most played champ for profile image instead of best mastery points or user choice?
-Its possible on future to make a web page for runes/masteries or a save/load to archive?

For the profile image we chose your recently played champion, which also shows up when you hover over yourself in the friends list.  The intention was to have the profile feel a bit more alive and be representative of what you're currently playing.  When you visit your friend's profile you'll see what they're recently playing so that you and your friend's profiles feel more unique.

-EDIT

Also if you own an ultimate skin, such as DJ Sona, Spirit Guard Udyr or Pulsefire Ezreal, selecting one of the corresponding summoner icons will get you an animated version of the image on the profile page.

> [{quoted}](name=richilimón,realm=EUW,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=k6KVKAG3,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-05-20T05:51:20.612+0000)

Hey! Let me pick up the tech portion of your question. It's a really good callout, because while we're eager to get the updated client out to folks we definitely don't want to disrupt anyone who is playing on the legacy client.

To achieve this, we put a lot of care into making sure that the updated client  and the legacy client can speak the same language - so chat messages, statuses, invites and all that other good stuff can move between both clients freely without either one getting confused.

> To achieve this, we put a lot of care into making sure that the updated client and the legacy client can speak the same language

Ah, thanks for mentioning that. Yes - both clients are completely interoperable as we haven't changed the platform protocols that they use to talk to our servers.
